content: Any advice for the creation of an Encounter with a machine? Encounter.participant.individual doesn't allow a Device. I'm planning on modeling the machine as a Practitioner, but it's a squeeze...

That is quite a squeeze, log a tracker for consideration?
Are there other places where this is happening? Doing an appoint. Ent/scheduling too?

Interesting. It would be informative to have details of a specific use case. I often check my blood pressure using a machine located at my local general practice, but these are not classified as encounters, or recorded as such, under the local (NZ) definition of encounter - i.e. they aren't scheduled or part of an encompassing clinical encounter.
ICD W31.9XXA. Interestingly, I could not find a suitable ICD code for 'wounded by medical device'. well, there is Y82.8
Extend Encounter.paticipant with a reference to Device.

@Brian Postlethwaite I'll open a tracker. We're certainly going to start seeing triage consultations with bots more and more, and these would have many of the characteristics of a traditional (or maybe telehealth) encounter.
Device's definition leans towards a physical durable medical device and less towards software services, but it's closer than the current notion of Practitioner
